Text.Value: Yes... For are we not all in need of a cure?
Your diligence is exemplary. Very well: your own scalpel you will be.
You teach Shar's ways with grace, for such an... altered being.
Just kill them already - all this torture is pointless.
There is misdirection in your words. You seek to linger in your sickness.
Your subject is tainted. Shar's succour must only be granted to the willing.
Attack.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon stand by a table upon which a wriggling human lies strapped down in an X position. Several Darkcloak sisters stand by, each with a scalpel in hand. The surgeonâ€™s voice is very gentle - the voice of a father explaining something to his young child.

Text.Value: In my experience, torture is usually more pain and less proselytising.
The crux of our worship.
The goddess has greater plans for me than to submit to your scalpels.
You do me an honour, but I am not worthy. Show me the way of Shar - I beg of you.
You will stop this sick spectacle at once.
If light is the symptom, then darkness is the cure, for in light there is presence, but in darkness there is absence.
Attack.

EditorData.stateContext:
Surgeon has scalpel-like fingers unfolded, Sisters holding scalpels
Human alive, strapped to table

Text.Value: I rather think your sacrifice will be quite masterful enough for our purposes.
Perhaps it is our unexpected audience that makes you quiver.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Surgeon now looks straight at us, perfectly aware of our presence all this time. He points in our direction with his scalpel-finger and as he does so, all attending Darkcloak sister turn to us as well. It is a menacing sight.

Text.Value: 'Only with sacrifice is mastery gained.' For the sisters to learn, you must submit.
*Although you're well acquainted with most blades - implements of medicine aren't really your speciality.*
You are to be commended for their graduation - rewarded with the promised cure.
Then I dub thee master.
See? What is the light of eyes but the cancer that causes one to witness the laceration of being?
Observe - then succeed me, into the succour of Shar.
Cast your gaze over the blades of the sisters.
Why not have them hone their skills on each other?
What lesson are you teaching these sisters?
Loss.
But you: look how the succour of Shar eludes you. See how painfully present you remain...
I take joy in performing with a master of my craft - I'm sure the sisters are the same. Why don't you volunteer?
In light is presence; in darkness, absence.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Darkcloak sisters all intone this line like a prayer as they raise their scalpels in our direction.

Text.Value: And the rough vessels that are yours.
But you: look how the succour of Shar eludes even you, one who walks faithfully in her shadow. See how painfully present you remain...
My magic has blinded me - I see now that Shar is the only path. Show me how - I beg of you.
A student, yes. Do please enlighten me.
You are well on your way. But one white orb disfigures you still. Let us finish the cure.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) They are all poised to strike.

Text.Value: *Try as you might, you can't think of any relevant teachings.*
It is the scalpel-led journey that leads from pain to peace.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Stabs patient in eyes with Scalpel <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) On the words â€˜painâ€™ and â€˜peaceâ€™ he stabs the patient hard in each eye with his blade-finger, blinding it. It utters bloodcurdling screams.

Text.Value: *The sisters' blades are bloodied and dull. Only the most measured hand could make a clean incision.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a blade in one of the nurse's shaking hands. It is dull and somewhat rusted / caked with dried blood.

Text.Value: Absence, sisters. Acquaint yourselves.

EditorData.AnimationTags: The sisters turn on each other, beginning combat with each other and the surgeon <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The sisters turn on each other, beginning combat with each other and the surgeon

Text.Value: They need a better subject to practise on first. Not a student, but a master.
I am but a fumbling squire before a master swordsman. Please, demonstrate so that I might learn.
The scalpel soothes. Come sing its song. We would hear your melody of mercy.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone these words together, then attack us.

Text.Value: What the fuck is this loon talking about.

EditorData.NodeContext: In mild wonder cause the thing she's reacting to is very outlandish.

Text.Value: Sparring is vital to progress. Have them practice on each other.
The sisters aren't ready. They'll make me sick instead of curing me.
There is no greater joy than watching a master at work. You are their teacher - who better to volunteer?
How to steady their hands, I wonder.
The final lesson. Yes. For to teach absence, one must become absent.
Only a beast of a man toys with his victim. Entertaining, if not efficient.
And yet, these sisters must exercise their gifts, for the art of absence lies in its execution.
See how the patient reacts when I but stroke the right nerve. Hear its comfort. Hear the very melody of mercy.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Victim thrashes as scalpel into shoulder <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The Surgeon inserts his scalpel-finger into a nerve cluster in the humanâ€™s shoulder. Flesh parts and blood gushes. The screams of the human are so loud they nearly drown out the Surgeonâ€™s words.

Text.Value: I sought purpose in the natural world - I see now that Shar is the only path. Show me how - I beg of you.
How your sickness misdirects you! Blinded by luminous eyes. What say you to this, dear sisters?
*The sisters' blades are unkempt, rusted with blood. Even in your skilled hands, a clean cut would be difficult.*
What wrong has this man done to deserve such torture?
I don't wish to study, only to lift the curse on this land.
Sick. Quite. But on the cusp of a cure:
Absence.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) All the sisters intone the word together.

Text.Value: And how gracious of you, master, to tender your own flesh.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) En masse, the sisters fall on the Surgeon like the senators on Caesar. They stab and keep stabbing the Surgeon with their scalpels until thereâ€™s nothing left but a bloody mess. After itâ€™s over, the sisters stay in place to perform a Sharran prayer. Theyâ€™ve no regard for us - weâ€™ve dealt with the Surgeon without having to combat him.

Text.Value: Come, sisters. Soothe me.
Sisters, what say we to such wretches?
I suffer from boredom. The cure is ripping you apart.
Hells. Only a monster would inflict misery and call it medicine.
Hmmm. 'Only the willing may know the Lady's embrace.' You know her teachings well.
When the fist trembles, sometimes another is needed to steady it. A good master would volunteer themselves.

EditorData.stateContext: Surgeon lying on table, Sisters holding scalpels Patient dead, lying on floor

Text.Value: You are the cause of the only suffering here - I am duty-bound to end you.
A stinging truth - but a truth nonetheless.

EditorData.NodeContext: Agreeable, as if listening to sage wisdom

Text.Value: Darkness.
Sisters. Speak the truth that I have taught you.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the sisters in the room.

Text.Value: Recall what you know of Shar's blasphemous teachings.
I would rather acquaint myself - if you show me how.
May Shar guide your blessing hands.
Secrecy.
I have read your treatise. Initiate the final lesson, or die by my hand.
It is a proud moment when one sees one's teachings so lovingly taken to heart.
Go on. Acquaint the face of ignorance with the true object of our studies.
A curse? Nay, a cure that leads to the very pinnacle of being:
I see now. By example I must edify and quell the light that blinds us.
I am not worthy! Please, show me how a master works - I would be honoured.
The sisters require a willing volunteer, a master of the art.
Examine the sisters and their implements.
What say you to the master, sisters?
*You remember a Sharran maxim: 'Go forth and sow doubt, but do not compel it - for only the willing may know the Lady's embrace.'*

EditorData.AnimationTags: Surgeon slashes throat, pushes Victim off the table. Lies down on table. <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) We see the Surgeon slice the patient's throat. As blood spurts everywhere, he pushes the dead man off the table with such force that its restraints break, showing how mighty a foe was awaiting us in combat. He lies down on the operating table and assumes the X position.

Text.Value: Gods, what living nightmare is this?
I am a scholar, this is true - just not in the study of torture.
Precisely.
Tell me, what is the guiding principle of the goddess?
The objective of the scalpel, sisters, is to soothe, for the scalpel, indeed, is an extension of Shar.

EditorData.AnimationTags: The bewildered human thrashes against its restraints to no avail <DAN>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The bewildered human thrashes against its restraints to no avail as the Surgeon speaks. He is holding his scalpel-like fingers high like a sacred object.

Text.Value: Not altered, sister - elevated. Long have I basked in Shar's embrace. A vessel of her will I have become.
Come, I will acquaint you with the Lady's dark-fingered embrace.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) He holds up his scalpel hand menacingly, clearly poised to strike at us.

Text.Value: Come. Step forward. I can see the love of Shar darken your eyes. Be welcome.
Practice - that's how I got good with a blade. They should spar each other.
Absence. No other word captures the heart of Shar so very perfectly.
I profess there is another more profound.
Attack.
In my years of study, I have found no better teacher than example. Perhaps you could volunteer?
Oh, but the final lesson is hardly at hand. Would you deny my sisters the full breadth of my teachings?
We do not wish to see you suffer so. Let us cure you.
Come. Step forward. You are no sister, but that matters none. Every student is welcome.
Yes. Submit I must, into the Lady's dark-fingered embrace.
Stop. Stay your hand, for it slaps where it should stroke. We can hardly hear the patient's sighs of solace.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Though the surgeon admonishes the Darkcloak sister, he does so in the same, gentle tone. There is no anger here, only paternal instruction. As he speaks, the Darkcloak sister bows her head in shame and takes a step back.

Text.Value: Another absence is your fate? But if you are not here to be cured, how will my sisters learn?
Oh but hush. Hold still. Let there be an end to your suffering.
The scalpel does not discriminate. Let each and every one of you partake in its soothing journey.
Your blades are in an atrocious condition - no way you'd make a clean cut with those.
Their blades are uneven. Efficient surgery will require further training.
Absence.
I will make you intimately familiar.
Their incisions are, as yet, still streaked with imprecision - that much I must concede.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Screaming and slashing, the sisters brutally murder each other.

Text.Value: Attack.
He's just like Cazador - utterly insane.
Pray, sister, show us the extent of your beneficence.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) With his free hand he very gently invites one of the Darkcloak sisters to cut into the human.

Text.Value: *You note nothing unusual about the sisters, aside from their menace.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows a nearby sister. She remains still, oblivious to your inspection.

(Cine) The Darkcloak sister approaches - she looks uncertain of herself. She cuts into the humanâ€™s belly, but itâ€™s a superficial and hesitant incision. The humann clenches its teeth and hisses in pain, but nothing like when the Surgeon applied his scalpel-finger.

Text.Value: Behold, sisters, the very face of ignorance - one who mistakes tenderness for torture.
I confess I'm unfamiliar with the ritual you're practising.
Forgetfulness.
How to proceed, I wonder.
I am no student, I seek knowledge of the curse. It is a blight on this land.
Recall what you know of Shar's teachings.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The surgeon brings two of his scalpel fingers to his own eyes, then thrusts them in hard, all the way through and out of the back of his head. For a few moments he stands there in silence, the blood oozing richly out of his destroyed eyes and out of the exit wounds, then he collapses. It is over.

Text.Value: Hush. Fret not so. You are quite ready, aren't you, sisters?

Synopsis: Surgeon in the Cursed Town. In the ruins of a hospital, a twisted, monstrous surgeon - corrupted by the shadowcurse around him - is operating on a human strapped to a reclining chair. The operation is essentially torture, with the surgeon stripping away the human's senses (eyes, tongue have been removed), but the surgeon believes he's doing what he needs to to help his 'patient'.
